channel.title: geopackage on Joe k Bullard
channel.description: Recent content in geopackage on Joe k Bullard

item.title: GeoPackage and Python - Part 1
item.description: GeoPackage (GPKG) is a spatial format that many QGIS users will be familiar with, as a format it offers many advantages over the ubiquitous shapefile format. In short, the Geopackage Encoding Standard enforces a set of rules and standards for storing vector features (Points, Lines, Polygons) and raster data in an SQLite database. While many people will use GPKG as a like-for-like shapefile replacement, through knowledge of some fairly basic SQL it can offer some of the advanced functionality typically associated with spatial databases such as PostgreSQL/PostGIS.
